title: Creating a New Branch üåø
ques:
You want to work on a new feature without affecting the main codebase.

Create a new branch named **`feature-login`** (do not switch to it yet).
explanation: **`git branch <branch-name>`** creates a new branch pointer at the current commit. It does not switch you to that branch.

title: Switching Branches üîÄ
ques:
You have created the `feature-login` branch.

Now, **switch** to this branch to start working on it.
explanation: **`git checkout <branch-name>`** (or **`git switch <branch-name>`**) updates the files in your working directory to match the version stored in that branch.

title: Create and Switch Shortcut ‚ö°
ques:
There is a faster way to create and switch to a branch in one command.

Create and switch to a new branch named **`bugfix-header`** using a single command.
explanation: **`git checkout -b <branch-name>`** is a shortcut that creates a new branch and immediately switches to it.

title: Deleting a Branch üóëÔ∏è
ques:
You have finished working on `bugfix-header` and merged it. Now you want to delete it to keep your repository clean.

Delete the **`bugfix-header`** branch.
explanation: **`git branch -d <branch-name>`** deletes the specified branch. Git will prevent deletion if the branch has unmerged changes (unless you use **`-D`**).

title: Resolving Merge Conflicts ‚ö†Ô∏è
ques:
You try to merge `feature-login` into `main`, but Git reports a **merge conflict** in `index.html`. You have manually edited `index.html` to resolve the conflict.

What are the next **two steps** to complete the merge?
explanation: After manually resolving conflicts in a file, you must **stage** the file using **`git add`** to mark it as resolved, and then run **`git commit`** to finalize the merge.
